sprite.name: Goomba
sprite.notes: A simple walking mushroom head that takes 1 hit to kill.

list.title: Spawned Child Direction (No ground pound)
list.comment: Controls the direction (and z order) of the Goombas spawned by a Medium Goomba, without ground pound. Higher values cause an overflow with probably unexpected results.

value.title: Additional Pipe Goomba Z-Order
value.comment: Additional Z-Order nybble

list.title: Spawned Child Direction (Ground pound)
list.comment: Controls the direction (and z order) of the Goombas spawned by a bigger Goomba with a ground pound. Higher values cause an overflow with probably unexpected results.

checkbox.title: Z-Order
checkbox.comment: Unused! Checking this box places the Goomba behind layer 1 tiles and other sprites.

checkbox.title: Doesn't disappear
checkbox.comment: When checked, this Goomba doesn't despawn when leaving the visible camera window.

list.title: Pipe Direction
list.comment: This sets the pipe direction for Pipe Enemy Generator Goombas.

list.title: Type
list.comment: This nybble is not used by sprites, but by other sprites spawning the Goomba. It makes the Goomba change its initial behavior, for example jump a little when it comes out of a Big Goomba. The Yoshi state does nothing, because no Yoshi is linked to the Goomba.
list.entry: Spins in circles (used by kamek icicle)
Very slow animation for a short time then normal
Spawned by Medium or Big Goomba (ground pound)

sprite.name: Paragoomba
sprite.notes: A Goomba that is able to jump using its wings. It can jump two blocks high at max. Jumping on it makes it a normal Goomba.

checkbox.title: Z-Order
checkbox.comment: This places the sprite behind Layer 1 tiles if checked.

sprite.name: Pipe Piranha Plant - Up
sprite.notes: A Piranha Plant that comes out of a pipe, then hides in the pipe, then comes out of it again and so on.

checkbox.title: Spawn outside pipe
checkbox.comment: The Piranha Plant will already be outside the pipe it is placed on when spawned if checked.

sprite.name: Pipe Piranha Plant - Down
sprite.notes: A Piranha Plant that comes out of a pipe, then hides in the pipe, then comes out of it again and so on.

checkbox.title: Spawn outside pipe
checkbox.comment: The Piranha Plant will already be outside the pipe it is placed on when spawned if checked.

sprite.name: Pipe Piranha Plant - Left
sprite.notes: A Piranha Plant that comes out of a pipe, then hides in the pipe, then comes out of it again and so on.

checkbox.title: Spawn outside pipe
checkbox.comment: The Piranha Plant will already be outside the pipe it is placed on when spawned if checked.

sprite.name: Pipe Piranha Plant - Right
sprite.notes: A Piranha Plant that comes out of a pipe, then hides in the pipe, then comes out of it again and so on.

checkbox.title: Spawn outside pipe
checkbox.comment: The Piranha Plant will already be outside the pipe it is placed on when spawned if checked.

sprite.name: Pipe Venus Fire Trap - Up
sprite.notes: A fire spitting Pipe Piranha Plant. It moves out of its pipe to spit fire towards the player, then hides in the pipe only to come out of the pipe and spit fire towards the player again and so on. Yoshi can eat these fireballs and spit them out again; that fireball then goes through Layer 1 tiles and sprites, defeats enemies and melts ice.

checkbox.title: Crash
checkbox.comment: Doing anything with this nybble will crash the game.

Yoshi can eat these fireballs and spit them out again; that fireball then goes through Layer 1 tiles and sprites, defeats enemies and melts ice.

sprite.name: Grounded Piranha Plant
sprite.notes: Instead of being in a pipe, this Piranha Plant is planted in the ground and tries to bite the player. Has the option to enable physics and gravity.

checkbox.title: Affected by gravity
checkbox.comment: Makes the Piranha Plant fall if nothing is underneath it, and also spawn with a different load-in animation.

value.title: Rotation
value.comment: Sets the direction of the Piranha Plant. 0 is up, every value rotates the Piranha Plant 22.5 degrees clockwise.

checkbox.title: Spawns on ground
checkbox.comment: This will make the Piranha Plant spawn on the first solid ground (including sprites) below it, even if it's placed in mid-air.

sprite.name: Grounded Venus Fire Trap
sprite.notes: Yoshi can eat these fireballs and spit them out again; that fireball then goes through layer 1 tiles and sprites, defeats enemies and melts ice.

checkbox.title: Affected by gravity
checkbox.comment: Makes the Venus Fire Trap fall if nothing is underneath it.

value.title: Rotation
value.comment: Sets the direction of the Venus Fire Trap. 0 is up, every value rotates the Venus Fire Trap 22.5 degrees clockwise.

sprite.name: Grounded Venus Ice Trap
sprite.notes: Instead of being in a pipe, this Venus Ice Trap is planted in the ground and spits ice balls towards the player. Yoshi can eat these ice balls and spit them out again; that ice ball then goes through layer 1 tiles and sprites and freezes enemies.

checkbox.title: Affected by gravity
checkbox.comment: Makes the Venus Ice Trap fall if nothing is underneath it.

value.title: Rotation
value.comment: Sets the direction of the Venus Ice Trap. 0 is up, every value rotates the Venus Ice Trap 22.5 degrees clockwise.

sprite.name: Giant Grounded Piranha Plant
sprite.notes: Instead of being in a pipe, this Giant Piranha Plant is planted in the ground and tries to bite the player. This enemy needs three of Fire Mario's fireballs to defeat it instead of just one.

value.title: Affected by gravity
value.comment: Makes the plant fall if nothing is underneath it.

value.title: Rotation
value.comment: Sets the direction of the piranha plant. 0 is up, every value rotates the piranha 22.5 degrees clockwise.

sprite.name: Giant Grounded Venus Fire Trap
sprite.notes: Instead of being in a pipe, this Giant Venus Fire Trap is planted in the ground and spits fireballs towards the player. Yoshi can eat these fireballs and spit them out again; that fireball then goes through layer 1 tiles and sprites, defeats enemies and melts ice.

checkbox.title: Affected by gravity
checkbox.comment: Makes the Giant Grounded Venus Fire Trap fall if nothing is underneath it.

value.title: Rotation
value.comment: Sets the direction of the Giant Grounded Venus Fire Trap. 0 is up, every value rotates it 22.5 degrees clockwise.

sprite.name: Koopa Troopa
sprite.notes: A familiar shelled foe: The Koopa Troopa. Since 1989. Jumping on it makes it hide in its shell which can then be kicked or picked up and then thrown by the player. After a specific amount of time, it comes out of its shell again.

list.title: Spawns
list.comment: Can't be higher than 7. But seems to be a flag?

checkbox.title: Allow the staircase 1UP Trick
checkbox.comment: If this is not checked, the classic Koopa 1UP-Staircase trick is not possible to pull off

checkbox.title: Starts Walking Right
checkbox.comment: The Koopa Troopa spawns walking to the right instead of walking to the left.

checkbox.title: Spawns being in Shell
checkbox.comment: When checked, the Koopa Troopa will spawn hiding in its shell.

list.title: Color
list.comment: If set to "Red", the Koopa Troopa won't walk off ledges.

value.title: Unknown Value 19
value.comment: Probably does nothing

checkbox.title: Spawns on ground
checkbox.comment: This will make the Koopa Troopa spawn on the first solid ground (including sprites) below it, even if it's placed in mid-air.

sprite.name: Koopa Paratroopa
sprite.notes: A koopa troopa with wings. Can either jump or fly depending on what you set it to. The default is "jumping". Red koopa paratroopas will not walk off cliffs, and the green ones will. The size of the koopa paratroopas wings are also different (green having shorter wings, red having longer wings).

list.title: Initial direction
list.comment: The movement of the Koopa Paratroopa when it is spawned.

list.title: Flying Start Position
list.comment: The path starts from this position relative to the location of the Koopa Paratroopa's placement.

list.title: Color
list.comment: Red Koopa Troopas don't walk off ledges.

sprite.name: Grouped Koopa Paratroopa
sprite.notes: A Koopa Troopa with wings which allow it to jump or even fly. It can jump two blocks high at max. Jumping on it makes it a normal Koopa Troopa. This Koopa Paratroopa's movements can be linked together with others for synchronization.

value.title: Group ID
value.comment: The ID used to chain sprites together. Use sprite 196 to create the groups. If not linked, the Koopa Paratroopa will appear frozen and collisionless. If linked, this sprite's movement is synced to other Koopa Paratroopa's that are linked to the same group controller.

list.title: Flying Start Position
list.comment: The path starts from this position relative to the location of the Koopa Paratroopa's placement.

list.title: Color
list.comment: Red Koopa Troopas don't walk off ledges.

checkbox.title: Unknown Checkbox 9
checkbox.comment: No visible effect...as far as I can see.

list.title: Type
list.comment: The form of the buzzy beetle the sprite spawns. 2 and 3 are unused.

sprite.name: Spiny
sprite.notes: A spiked enemy. Usually thrown out of Lakitus and seen in underground levels.

list.title: Type
list.comment: Unused from NSMBW.

sprite.name: Checkpoint Flag
sprite.notes: When Mario collides with this flagpole, the game will set Mario's spawn point to it. The flag will turn into the color of the player (Mario = red, Luigi = green, YToad = yellow, BToad = blue) and will give the player who collides with it a mushroom. If a player dies in the same level, then the game will respawn all players at the flagpole. If someone decides to play another level or completes the level with the flagpole active, then the game will reset all memory in the flagpole and reset the spawn point location.

value.title: Useless(?) Value 5
value.comment: This field is no longer even referenced in the code.

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: The entrance when the player will be spawned if he dies after reaching the midway flag.

list.title: Appears
list.entry: Only if midway flag is not yet touched
Only if midway flag is already touched

checkbox.title: Second checkpoint
checkbox.comment: Set this if this is the second midway point in the level.

sprite.name: Zoom Area
sprite.notes: Screen width and height (in blocks) with the different zoom values are: -2 = H:7 W:12.4, -1 = H:10.5 W:18.7, 0 = H:14 W:24.9, 1 = H:17 W:30.2, 2 = H:19 W:33.8, 3 = H:20 W:35.6, 4 = H:24 W:42.7, 5 = H:28 W:49.8

checkbox.title: Disables Scroll Limit
checkbox.comment: When the player enters this zoom area if there are any scroll limit sprites that have 'Disabled by Zoom Area' checked it will deactivate them.

list.title: Zoom Value
list.comment: Changes what zoom it will have when the player enters the area. *Zoom 0 takes priority if many zoom areas are in one place.

list.title: Triggered if
list.entry: One player at least is in the zoom area
Same as 0 but only works in single player mode
Same as 0 but only works in multiplayer mode
A koopa/buzzy beetle shell enters the zoom area

value.title: Height
value.comment: The height of the zoom area

value.title: Width
value.comment: The width of the zoom area

sprite.name: Goal Pole
sprite.notes: Ends the level for the player (if the stage doesn't have a boss). Where the player lands on the Goal Pole determines how many points the player will earn. Player receives a 1-up at the very top.

checkbox.title: Secret Exit
checkbox.comment: Makes the path when the level is completed lead to the secret path, and changes the appearance.

checkbox.title: No Castle
checkbox.comment: There is no castle. Mario will just walk to the right for a while and then stand still.

checkbox.title: Snowy Castle
checkbox.comment: Makes the castle laden with snow, for snowy/icy levels.

sprite.name: Arrow Signboard
sprite.notes: Helps the player find the way to the end of the level, and can even have a different look to fit the level theme.

checkbox.title: Don't Appear In Challenges
checkbox.comment: Some of the original levels are used in challenge mode. This setting makes the signboard not appear in those challenges at all.

list.title: Appearance
list.comment: Use this to give your sign board a fitting theme. Value 2 is supposed to be 'Big', but crashes the game.

checkbox.title: Is path controlled
checkbox.comment: Will forcibly disable "Affected by gravity".

checkbox.title: Place behind other sprites
checkbox.comment: Changes z-order to -2500 if the other z-order nybble is 0

checkbox.title: Affected by gravity
checkbox.comment: Will be forcibly disabled if "Is path controlled" is enabled.

list.title: Inscription
list.comment: Sets the inscription of the signboard.

checkbox.title: Use above collision sensor
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the above collision sensor will be set instead of the adjacent ones. Needs "Affected by gravity" to be enabled.

value.title: Unknown Value 16
value.comment: [1 bit?] No visible change. Only used in as 1 or 0. Levels: NSLU5-21A1 and NSLU5-17A1

value.title: Unknown Value 20
value.comment: [2 bits?] Related to "Affected by gravity". If that bit is not set and this bit is, the level will crash on Cemu.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Bolt ID / Path Controller ID

value.title: No-spawn Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this value is nonzero, the Grrrol only spawns if this event is deactivated.

value.title: Unknown Value 5
value.comment: Some kind of bitfield. Probably changes behavior of the Grrrol.

checkbox.title: No slow wall bounce
checkbox.comment: The Grrrol's speed is not reduced temporarily when hitting a wall

checkbox.title: Only spawns when facing to player

list.title: Speed
list.comment: *Value 0 is unused in the game, it makes the grrrol move to the right (ignoring the directional nybble) and when hitting a wall it will bounce back but not change its direction. If this value is used with 'No slow wall bounce' the grrrol will bounce back to its start position (or max 16 blocks on a flat surface) when hitting a wall and then roll back towards the wall again.

value.title: No-spawn Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this value is nonzero, the Grrrol only spawns if this event is deactivated.

value.title: Unknown Value 5
value.comment: Some kind of bitfield. Probably changes behavior of the Grrrol.

checkbox.title: No slow wall bounce
checkbox.comment: The Grrrol's speed is not reduced temporarily when hitting a wall

checkbox.title: Only spawns when facing to player

list.title: Speed
list.comment: *Value 0 is unused in the game, it makes the grrrol move to the right (ignoring the directional nybble) and when hitting a wall it will bounce back but not change its direction. If this value is used with 'No slow wall bounce' the grrrol will bounce back to its start position (or max 16 blocks on a flat surface) when hitting a wall and then roll back towards the wall again.

sprite.name: Seaweed
sprite.notes: Use this sprite to give your beach and underwater levels a fitting feel.

list.title: Leaf Count
list.entry: One big leaf and a smaller leaf on the right
One big leaf and two smaller leaves

sprite.name: Zone-Enter-Triggered Event Controller
sprite.notes: This sprite activates or deactivates up to 2 events when you enter a zone.

value.title: Time active
value.comment: Only used if the sprite is activating an event.

checkbox.title: Does nothing
checkbox.comment: Disables the sprite's function

sprite.name: Event Controller - AND ("if X AND Y, do Z")

value.title: Triggering Event ID 1
value.comment: Don't leave as 0; put the same event multiple times if less than four events should activate the Target ID.

value.title: Triggering Event ID 2
value.comment: Don't leave as 0; put the same event multiple times if less than four events should activate the Target ID.

value.title: Triggering Event ID 3
value.comment: Don't leave as 0; put the same event multiple times if less than four events should activate the Target ID.

value.title: Triggering Event ID 4
value.comment: Don't leave as 0; put the same event multiple times if less than four events should activate the Target ID.

list.title: Usage Mode
list.entry: Only while All Events are Active

sprite.notes: This sprite is glitched in the launch version of NSMBU and works exactly like a sprite 37 (AND). It was fixed in an update, however.

value.title: Triggering Event ID 1
value.comment: Don't leave as 0; put the same event multiple times if less that four events should activate the Target ID.

value.title: Triggering Event ID 2
value.comment: Don't leave as 0; put the same event multiple times if less that four events should activate the Target ID.

value.title: Triggering Event ID 3
value.comment: Don't leave as 0; put the same event multiple times if less that four events should activate the Target ID.

value.title: Triggering Event ID 4

list.title: Usage Mode
list.entry: Only while Any Event is Active

sprite.name: Event Controller - RANDOM ("if X, do Y OR Z") [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Triggers a randomly selected event from the four specified, or, if none are specified, event ID 1.

value.title: Target Event ID 1
value.comment: Don't leave as 0; put the same event multiple times if you want a smaller selection of events to trigger.

value.title: Target Event ID 2
value.comment: Don't leave as 0; put the same event multiple times if you want a smaller selection of events to trigger.

value.title: Target Event ID 3
value.comment: Don't leave as 0; put the same event multiple times if you want a smaller selection of events to trigger.

value.title: Target Event ID 4
value.comment: Don't leave as 0; put the same event multiple times if you want a smaller selection of events to trigger.

sprite.name: Event Controller - Chainer ("if X, do Y")

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Operation is performed when this event is activated.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This is the event the operation is performed on.

value.title: Delay / Duration
value.comment: The delay between the activation of the Triggering Event ID and the operation.

list.title: Delay Mode
list.comment: If the switch mode is "0: Activate Event" and this nybble is 0, the chainer deactivates the event when triggered, and reactivates it after the delay. If this nybble is 1, it activates the event when it's triggered and deactivates it after the delay. Same thing if switch mode is "1: Deactivate Event", except the other way round.

list.title: Switch Mode
list.comment: What should be done to the Target ID after the delay.

checkbox.title: Special deletion flag
checkbox.comment: Only useful if two chainers are used that are placed on top of each other, and both have this flag enabled. If one of the two chainers gets activated (this one must be set to single use), the game deletes the other one when reloading the zone, making sure that chainer is never activated.

value.title: Useless
value.comment: Nintendo used the movement id nybbles a few times, but it isn't used by the game.

list.title: Players that must be in the location

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: Event ID that is activated once the condions are met.

value.title: Player Location ID
value.comment: Set the location ID the player needs to be in for the Event to be turned on.

checkbox.title: Ignore player location
checkbox.comment: Tick this to disregard the player location ID

value.title: Enemy Location ID
value.comment: Set the location ID the enemy needs to be in for the Event to be turned on.

checkbox.title: Ignore enemy location
checkbox.comment: Tick this to disregard the enemy location ID

list.title: Player powerup
list.comment: Extra condition: Player must have this powerup.
list.entry: Any powerup except small and mini

list.title: Player status
list.comment: Extra condition: Player must be in this state.
list.entry: Spin jump or spinning with propeller suit

list.title: Usage Mode
list.comment: 0 - Event is only triggered once, when the Mario Status and Enemy Status are satisfied, 1 - Event is triggered each time the Mario Status and Enemy Status are satisfied, but does not revert to the opposite state unless forced to by another controller, 2 - Event is only triggered while Mario Status and Enemy Status are satisfied.
list.entry: Only while both Mario and Enemy Status are satisfied

list.title: Switch Mode
list.comment: If this option is set to "Deactivates Target", the activation modes will be reversed - for example, Activation Mode 2 will deactivate the event while you're touching the area, and reactivate it when you leave.

sprite.name: Event Controller - Multi-chainer ("if X, do Y through Z")

value.title: Delay
value.comment: 10 frames per value

list.title: Usage Mode
list.comment: When the triggering event is activated, the multi chain starts running, until it reaches the last event. If this is a multi-use chainer, it starts deactivating all events when the first event is deactivated.

sprite.name: Timed Event State Switch Controller
sprite.notes: After the delay, the sprite starts activating, and after a while deactivating, the event. All these delays go up to 255. Their unit is 10 frames.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: Event ID that is affected

value.title: Duration OFF
value.comment: The time the event is activated

value.title: Duration ON
value.comment: The time the event is activated

value.title: Starting Delay
value.comment: Delay on screen enter

sprite.name: Red Coin Ring
sprite.notes: Red coins appear when a player jumps through this ring. Its prime use is to spawn red coins. When you collect all 8 red coins you will get a powerup.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: Use this to link the red ring with the red coins it spawns.

list.title: Reward
list.comment: This determines the powerup reward given when Mario is small or super. (* This WILL crash if you're small...but only in NSLU)

value.title: Coin Set ID
value.comment: Use this to link up 8 coins. 0 is a valid value.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this to assign the ring to a movement controller.

sprite.name: Star Coin
sprite.notes: There may be a nybble to disable falling from a pow block.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: Triggers this Event when collected.

checkbox.title: Don't appear in challenges + unknown behaviour depending on Nybble 8 Mask 2

list.title: Star coin number
list.comment: Sets the number of the star coin

list.title: Z-order and Collision Mask
list.comment: Z-order only works if the sprite is on layer 1. Else Z-order is set to -3000. *Mask 2 makes it so the player can't collect the star coin.

checkbox.title: Don't fall when POW is used

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this value to hook the Star Coin to a movement controller.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: The star coin will activate this ID when collected.

list.title: Star Coin Number
list.comment: Sets the number of the star coin.

list.title: Z-order and Collision Mask
list.comment: Z-order only works if the sprite is on layer 1. Else Z-order is set to -3000. *Mask 2 makes it so the player can't collect the star coin.

Powerup is determined by Mario's current state.

sprite.name: Flame Chomp
sprite.notes: Spawns a Flame Chomp.

sprite.name: Urchin
sprite.notes: The normal-sized, spiky fish that lives near the water's surface. It loves the warmth of the water geyser. Once shot with a fireball, the urchin will "die" and fall to the very bottom of the lake/ocean.

value.title: Chase Movement Distance (Down)
value.comment: Used with movement type 3. The urchin will move down this far when the player gets close under it and then up again.

value.title: Chase Movement Distance (Up)
value.comment: Used with movement type 3. The urchin will move up this far when the player gets close over it and then down again.

list.title: Rise/Fall Behavior
list.comment:
*Use this with Urchin type 2 to get the chasing behavior.

**Gravity doesn't work with Urchin type 0, with type 1 it will work correctly if the urchin is placed under water. Both types will slowly return back to its original move pattern if moved by something.

***Value 2 only gives the sinking effect to Urchin type 2.

list.title: Start Direction
list.comment: Used with movement type 1 and 2.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: Used with movement type 1 and 2. The urchin starts centered.

sprite.name: Movement-controlled Coin

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this to link this coin to a (sway) rotation controller.

value.title: Coin ID
value.comment: Assign this ID to crowd clapping controllers, and whatnot.

sprite.name: Water
sprite.notes: Another name for this is H2O. It is refreshing in warm areas, but it could freeze you in cold environments, so be careful! The water also is the natural habitat of many enemies, so once again, be careful! Based on the lava sprite, there should be nybbles for delays before rising/lowering, but the giant waves don't seem to work on this sprite.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: The ID that triggers the water to begin rising or falling.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: Once the water finishes rising/falling, this event is activated.

list.title: Rising/Lowering Speed/Direction
list.comment: Values with a * will cause the water to lower.

list.title: Appearance Modifier
list.entry: Topless/Invisible; use underwater background for this

value.title: Unknown Value 13
value.comment: Bitfield of some kind.

sprite.name: Lava
sprite.notes: This hot liquid hides different species that are adjusted to the high temperature. Mario, Luigi, Nabbit and the Toads are not, so be careful not to jump into this!

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: The ID that triggers the lava to begin rising or falling.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: Once the lava finishes rising/falling, this event is activated.

list.title: Rising/Lowering Speed/Direction
list.comment: Values without a * will cause the lava to rise. Values with a * will cause the lava to lower.

checkbox.title: Falling
checkbox.comment: Causes the lava to lower instead of rise.

value.title: Delay Before Lowering
value.comment: If the lava rises/falls, this modifies the delay before lowering.

value.title: Delay Before Rising
value.comment: This delay before rising will only take effect after the first round of rising/lowering.

value.title: Rising/Lowering Height
value.comment: The height the lava rises, in blocks.

list.title: Crest Wave Strength
list.comment: Seen http://i.imgur.com/vbwHW4u.jpg here. The top of the wave once it hits it's max height.

checkbox.title: Layer 0
checkbox.comment: Makes the lava spawn on layer 0 so the player can walk behind it.

checkbox.title: Topless
checkbox.comment: The lava will have no top, but will be fully functional.

list.title: Rise Slightly Before Falling
list.comment: If this is turned on, the lava will rise up half a tile before falling.

list.title: Giant Waves: Bounciness
list.comment: This causes the giant lava waves to bounce up and down.

list.title: Giant Waves: Mini-Wave Animation Speed
list.comment: The speed at which the mini-waves on top of each giant wave animate.

list.title: Giant Waves: Height of Mini-Waves
list.comment: This determines the height of each mini-wave on top of each giant wave.

list.title: Giant Waves: Width
list.comment: The width of each giant lava wave.

list.title: Giant Waves: Speed/Direction
list.comment: The speed of each giant lava wave. Values marked with a * cause the waves to move left instead of right.

list.title: Giant Waves: Height
list.comment: The height of each giant lava wave, in blocks.

checkbox.title: Giant Waves
checkbox.comment: When checked, this will create giant waves in the lava.

sprite.name: Poison Water
sprite.notes: Water that is <font color="purple">poisonous</font>. Kills the player upon touch.

list.title: Rising Speed
list.comment: The rising speed of the poison water.

value.title: Rising Height
value.comment: The height, in blocks, that the poison water will rise.

checkbox.title: Rising
checkbox.comment: If checked, the poisinous water will rise quickly.

sprite.name: Quicksand
sprite.notes:
Once Mario steps in, he will start sinking. Doesn't hurt him to stay inside of it, though.
If you use a location, make sure it sticks 5 blocks below the zone, or else it will not make the player die.

checkbox.title: Flat Top
checkbox.comment:
Checking this removes the animated crest effect on the top portion of the Sprite. Creates a 'square' look.
Note: Only use with a flat ceiling or else will look strange.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: Match with a Location to set the Area of this Sprite.

checkbox.comment: Use 'Stop Spawning Distance' to set how far away it needs to be.

value.comment: Used with movement type 3. The urchin will move down this far when the player gets close under it and then up again.

*Use this with Urchin type 2 to get the chasing behavior.

sprite.name: Movement Controller - Path
sprite.notes: Follows the path by default in a "curly", realistic manner. This means the game takes speed into account and calculates a path that is roughly the same as the path you set. This behaviour can be turned off to make this sprite function more like in previous games.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Movement gets activated when this Event ID is set.

checkbox.title: Smooth movement
checkbox.comment: This nybble is separate from the "Move strictly" nybble and uses a different algorithm.

checkbox.title: Move strictly
checkbox.comment: Used to determine how the path should be followed. Elaboration can be found in this sprite's notes.

list.title: When the last node is reached

checkbox.title: Reset when off-screen
checkbox.comment: When the path controller is off-screen, it resets itself to its original position and waits for the triggering event id to be activated, regardless of the "Event activated" checkbox.

sprite.name: Nothing. ("Environmental phenomena kun") [UNUSED]

checkbox.title: Randomise Spawn Delay
checkbox.comment: Makes each individual Cannon use a different Delay

list.title: Number of Pieces
list.comment: Value + 1, Maximum 8 (0-7). Determines the number of pieces for the Rotating Bullet Bill Launcher (Cannon Pieces plus Rotating Pivots). The lowest piece will appear at the Sprite's placement.

bitfield.title: Piece Type
bitfield.comment: Each checkbox will cause the piece type to change from Cannon to Rotating Pivot.

bitfield.title: Rotate Anim Direction
bitfield.comment: Determines, if each Piece will rotate clockwise or counterclockwise (birds-eye view). Clockwise means, the Piece will rotate from right to left 'around the front'. Pieces that rotate counterclockwise will move 'around the back' from left to right.

checkbox.title: Unknown Checkbox 17
checkbox.comment: No visual effects

checkbox.title: Unknown Checkbox 19
checkbox.comment: No visual effects

sprite.name: Event Controller - "?" Switch
sprite.notes: An orange switch with a question mark on it. It activates an event when pressed.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: The switch will trigger this event ID when pressed. If the event if already active when this switch spawns, it'll be pressed from the get-go.

checkbox.title: Affected by gravity
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the switch will be movable by the environment.

list.title: Delay on Multi Use
list.comment: This will set how long the switch takes to pop up after the timer expires on a Multi Use switch

checkbox.title: Non-timed
checkbox.comment: When checked, the event will not be timed when it's switched.

checkbox.title: Shift a tile vertically
checkbox.comment: Shift the switch a tile in the direction it's facing. Used by the game internally.

checkbox.title: Owned by Clampy
checkbox.comment: Used by the game internally. Do not use this!

checkbox.title: Deactivates Target
checkbox.comment: When checked, the switch will deactivate it's target. If the switch is timed, the event will reactivate after the timer is up.

checkbox.title: Multiple uses
checkbox.comment: If this is ticked, the switch will pop up after a while, and you can press it again.

checkbox.title: Shift a half-tile right
checkbox.comment: Ticking this will place the switch a half a tile to the right. This is a largely pointless leftover from New Super Mario Bros. DS.

checkbox.title: Upside-down
checkbox.comment: If this is ticked, the switch will be upside-down.

checkbox.title: Z-order
checkbox.comment: Changes z-pos to 128.0

sprite.notes: Name translates to "Pukupuku [Japanese name for Cheep Cheep] (formation)" Doesn't form any type of group at all by itself.

value.title: Swim Speed
value.comment: Alters the swim speed. Makes the cheep-cheep slower.

value.title: Row Length
value.comment: Value + 1.

value.title: Triggering Event ID 1
value.comment: If set to anything other than 0 the special exit only work after you have activated this event ID. If Triggering Event 2 is also set then if any of the two events are activated the special exit will work. NOTE: The special exit can also remember if you already have satisfied the condition for the exit and will than activate immediately after the event has been activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID 2
value.comment: If set to anything other than 0 the special exit only work after you have activated this event ID. If Triggering Event 1 is also set then if any of the two events are activated the special exit will work. NOTE: The special exit can also remember if you already have satisfied the condition for the exit and will than activate immediately after the event has been activated.

list.title: Delay
list.comment: Delay until activation after area has been touched.

list.title: Walk Direction
list.comment: If exit type is 1 or 2 it makes the player walk in this direction.

list.title: Exit Type
list.comment: Always use 'Reveal Paths On Exit' with type 2.

value.title: Entrance ID Overflow
value.comment: Part of the Entrance ID. If the Entrance ID you want to use is larger than 15 then use this. For every value it adds 16 to the Entrance ID. EXAMPLE: Overflow is set to 2 and the regular to 5 it would become 16 * 2 + 5 which is ID 37.

list.title: Player State
list.comment: Player must be in this state for the sprite to activate.

value.title: Width
value.comment: Use this to determine the width of the special exit controller. Value + 1

value.title: Height
value.comment: Use this to determine the height of the special exit controller. Value+1

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: The exit uses this entrance's destination.

checkbox.title: Unknown Checkbox 19 [NSLU]
checkbox.comment: Only used in NSLU 8-4 A1.

checkbox.title: Reveal Paths On Exit*
checkbox.comment: *If this is unchecked and exit type is 1 then when the players come back to the worldmap no path reveal animation is played, BUT you can still walk on the unrevealed paths.

sprite.name: Path-controlled Movement-controlled Movement Controller - Swaying
sprite.notes: Link this to a Movement Controller - Path (100).

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Use this to activate the movement once.

checkbox.title: Unknown Value 5
checkbox.comment: No effect at all.

list.title: Sway Start Offset
list.comment: Offset [Sway Direction]. Sway direction is inverted when 'Reversed Movement' is used.

checkbox.title: Unknown Value 7
checkbox.comment: No effect at all.

value.title: Sway Delay
value.comment: Delays the movement of the sprite when switching direction.

value.title: Swaying Speed
value.comment: The speed it sways.

sprite.name: Big Spinner (Ball 'n' Chain)
sprite.notes: A swinging spiked ball on a spiked chain. Does not spawn if not tied to a movement controller.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this to link this sprite to a rotation movement controller (68/69/116/118).

sprite.name: Path-controlled Movement Controller - Spinning
sprite.notes: Link this to a Movement Controller - Path (100).

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: The event that triggers the controller.

list.title: Starting Rotation
list.comment: The angle it starts rotating at. Used to desync other sprites.

value.title: Spins
value.comment: TODO: this is far too vague to be useful in any way.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: 0-7 = counterclockwise, 8+ = clockwise

value.title: Output Movement ID
value.comment: Match this with rotation-controlled sprites.

value.title: Input Movement ID
value.comment: Set this to make the rotation pivot point move!

value.title: Unknown Value 8
value.comment: This value is multiplied by 600.

checkbox.title: Approach From Background
checkbox.comment: Check this to make the lakitu spawn by coming from the background.

sprite.name: Spiny Cheep Cheep
sprite.notes: When a player is closer than 6 blocks to a spiny cheep, it starts chasing him until he is at least 16 blocks away from the spiny cheep.

value.title: Event ID
value.comment: Does not follow player when this event is active

value.title: Distance
value.comment: The distance it travels before turning around

checkbox.title: Always chase player
checkbox.comment: If this is not checked, the spiny cheep only starts going after the player when the distance between the player and spiny cheep is less than 6 blocks.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 9
checkbox.comment: Used by death clouds. My guess is that if this is unchecked the clouds never go go farther away than the left edge of the screen. Also seems to do something with an enemy raft?

checkbox.title: Move Left
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the clouds will move sideways, as seen in NSMBU's 5-Airship.

list.title: Type

list.entry: Spawned by Foo with 'No cloud' checked

checkbox.title: Hide Coins
checkbox.comment: Hides coins when checked. (4 coins)

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: The clouds will appear in this location.

sprite.name: Jumping Cheep Cheep Spawn Area

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: When the player is in this location, Cheep Cheeps will jump from below the screen.

value.title: Movement ID 1
value.comment: Links with 149.

checkbox.title: Desaturate

checkbox.title: Moves Clockwise
checkbox.comment: Ticking this will make the platform go counter-clockwise rather than clockwise.

value.title: Movement ID 2

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: When this ID is activated, the coaster will start moving.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this ID is activated, the spine coaster will activate something else.

value.title: Pair ID
value.comment: Any other Spine Coasters with the same Pair ID and have the checkbox below unticked will activate when the one with the below checkbox is activated. Do not have more than 1 with the checkbox per Pair ID

value.title: Speed
value.comment: Speed of the coaster when activated.

checkbox.title: Start moving when jumped on
checkbox.comment: Coaster will start moving when all onscreen players are on the coaster.

list.title: Length
list.comment: 0-7 Value, Value + 1. Increase the number of attached Platforms; begins again with 1 Platform at Value 8. Value 0 = Head (Skull) only. Size of Skull or one Platform = 1 x 2 Blocks.

value.title: Related to Pair Disabling
value.comment: Possible checkbox? Only used as 1 once. If set to 1, the spine coaster won't be able to pair with another coaster?

sprite.name: Thwomp
sprite.notes: Thwomps are living stones that are usually rectangular in shape and made their first appearance in the Super Mario Bros. 3. They typically attempt to fall on and flatten or squash whoever passes below them. They can only be defeated by being touched by Mario when he is powered up with a Super Star. It is suggested in Mario & Luigi: Partners in Time that Thwomps may in fact be born from volcanic activity.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: Makes the Thwomp fall if the player is in this location.

checkbox.title: Automatically Fall
checkbox.comment: Makes the Thwomp automatically fall, even if the player is not near it.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: Falls if the player is in this location.

checkbox.title: Automatically fall
checkbox.comment: Makes the super thwomp automatically fall.

checkbox.title: On moving platform
checkbox.comment: Check this option if you want to place a Dry Bones on a moving platform (place Dry Bones right above it). This crashes the game if there's no moving platform underneath.

sprite.name: Big Dry Bones
sprite.notes: Also known as "Super Dry Bones". This dry bone is much bigger than the original "drybones" and does not take damage unless the player ground pounds him. Any other attack (Jump, spin jump, etc) will just stop the drybones in its tracks, then continue walking.

checkbox.title: On moving platform
checkbox.comment: Check this option if you want to place a Big Dry Bones on a moving platform (place Big Dry Bones right above it).

sprite.name: Pipe - Up
sprite.notes: This sprite seems to be required for pipes to work correctly in-game. If this pipe is inside a quicksand (maybe other liquids as well) location, another pipe has to be placed directly on top of it to make the pipe show in front of the quicksand (maybe other liquids as well)... NOTE: This sprite cannot function as an entrance unless there are pipe tiles (from Pa0) behind the entire sprite!

list.title: Height-related
list.comment: The value with an asterisk has some glitchy behaviour when used as an enterable pipe.

list.title: Type
list.comment:
If the type is "Painted", 1 block extra is added to the height.

If the type is "Big", 2 blocks extra are added to the height.

There probably is a fourth option...

list.title: Color
list.comment: Set the color of your pipe! Value 3 is blue if the type is painted (or is it related to "height-related"?)

value.title: Height
value.comment: Value + 1 by default. If height-related is a value with an asterisk, the increment is 2 instead of 1. Additionally, another 2 blocks are added to the height if the type is "Big", or 1 extra block if the type is "Painted".

sprite.name: Water Geyser

list.title: Width
list.comment: The width of the geyser. (Value + 1) * 1.625.

value.title: Useless(?) Value 8
value.comment: This field is no longer even referenced in the code.

value.comment: This field is no longer even referenced in the code.

list.title: Rise Delay
list.comment: *If nybble 10-11 (Height) is bigger than 14, the delay is 90 frames (1.5 seconds). Otherwise, you get the delay from this list: { 0 = 125, 1 = 123, 2 = 121, 3 = 124, 4 = 118, 5 = 112, 6 = 109, 7 = 113, 8 = 110, 9 = 107, 10 = 104, 11 = 104, 12 = 101, 13 = 97, 14 = 94 }. 60 frames = 1 second.

list.title: Rise Time

sprite.name: Bob-omb
sprite.notes: A small bomb like creature that will explode after Mario jumps on its head or shoots a fireball at it. Can destroy certain blocks.

list.title: Type
list.comment: Changes the sprite's initial behavior. Actually, there is a difference between 2 and 6, regarding the internal bob-omb counter. Value 2 does not increment the internal bob-omb counter. This matters for example, when a cannon is placed nearby this bob-omb. The cannon only fires bob-ombs when this counter is less than 8.

value.title: Z-Position

value.title: Bomb ID (Bowser Jr W7) [Useless]
value.comment: This nybble is useless, because the bowser jr type crashes the game. When nybble 5 ("Type") is set to 5 (Bowser Jr throws multiple bob-ombs at once), all bob-ombs have an ascending id. This is probably used to change the direction the bob-omb he throws flies, so they don't all go into the same direction.

sprite.notes: A bullet bill launcher that can rise and lower, with various speeds! When setting initial state value to 1, the blaster will become a single bullet.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When checked, the Bill Blaster will be upside-down.

list.title: Direction

value.title: Height 2

checkbox.title: Physics related

value.title: Unknown Value 19

sprite.name: Banzai Bill Blaster / Spawner
sprite.notes: When setting initial state value to 1, the blaster will become a single bullet.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: Direction the Blaster fires to.

checkbox.title: Physics related
checkbox.comment: Does NOT make the blaster have gravity.

sprite.name: Upside-down Banzai Bill Blaster [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: A Banzai Bill Blaster, just upside down. Functions just like the regular Banzai Bill Blasters. When setting initial state value to 1, the blaster will become a single bullet.

list.comment: Direction the Blaster fires to.

checkbox.title: Physics related
checkbox.comment: Does NOT make the blaster have gravity.

sprite.name: Mechakoopa (+)
sprite.notes: A mechanical koopa that can be stepped on, picked up, and thrown. (+) The initial state flag is usable. IF set to 1, the mechakoopa will spawn in its down state.

sprite.name: Cannon
sprite.notes: A cannon that can fire Bob-ombs or cannonballs. Can even be upside-down, facing different directions, or move per shot!

list.title: Camera Behavior
list.comment: If the camera pans out while the ball is fired, the ball will slow down for the camera. If No, it will not.

value.title: Fire Delay
value.comment: The fire delay of the cannon.

list.title: Fires
list.comment: Values higher than 3 are not tested. The only difference between 1, 2 and 3 seems to be the number of bob-ombs they spawn.

checkbox.title: Rotates After Firing
checkbox.comment: When checked, the cannon will rotate 45 degrees in the other direction, fire, and repeat.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: Flips the cannon upside-down.

checkbox.title: Affected By Gravity
checkbox.comment: Causes the cannon to fall if it has no ground underneath it.

list.title: Facing
list.comment: Sets the direction of the cannon.

checkbox.title: Move with Ground
checkbox.comment: When checked, the Cannon can be placed on moving blocks.

sprite.name: 4-Way Cannon - Crashes [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: The files it tries to load don't exist.

sprite.name: Giant 4-Way Cannon - Crashes [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Files it tries to load don't exist.

sprite.name: Cannonball [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Requires sprite 176 to be in the area (or zone?).

list.title: Direction
list.comment: Values higher than 7 overflow the speed table, resulting in very fast moving cannonballs.

checkbox.title: Big
checkbox.comment: The ball gets scaled to 1.5 times its normal size, and its speed is doubled.

checkbox.title: Delay Throw
checkbox.comment: Makes the spike have a delayed throw.

sprite.name: Vertically-moving Platform
sprite.notes: A platform that moves up and down. It can be a certain length, move a certain distance, and more.

list.title: Type
list.comment: The type of platform.

list.title: Movement
list.comment: The movement of the platform.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: The distance it moves.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: The speed it moves.

value.title: Length
value.comment: The length of the platform.

sprite.name: Falling Icicle
sprite.notes: An icicle that falls when a player goes under it, or almost under it.

checkbox.title: Don't Fall
checkbox.comment: Makes the Icicle not fall down.

checkbox.title: Load in Small (Growing)
checkbox.comment: This makes the Icicle first appear small, then grow to it's normal size.

value.title: Vertical Distance
value.comment: When set, the horizontal distance from the player is ignored and the icicle will only fall when the player is 'value*2' blocks below at most. When the value is 0, the vertical distance is ignored and the icicle will only fall when the player is 4 blocks away at most. (Horizontally)

value.title: Respawn Delay
value.comment: If 'Vertical Distance' is not set, the delay is set to 30 frames (0.5 sec)

sprite.name: Giant Falling Icicle
sprite.notes: A giant version of the Falling Icicle, which falls once the player gets close enough under it. Its top and sides are solid, and it acts as a slippery platform. The triggering location extends exactly 7.5 tiles to the left of the icicle's actual position (that is, 8 tiles from a vertical line going right down the middle of the icicle).

checkbox.title: Don't Fall
checkbox.comment: Makes the Icicle not fall down.

checkbox.title: Load in Small (Growing)
checkbox.comment: This makes the Icicle first appear small, then grow to it's normal size.

value.title: Vertical Distance
value.comment: When set, the horizontal distance from the player is ignored and the icicle will only fall when the player is 'value*2' blocks below at most. When the value is 0, the vertical distance is ignored and the icicle will only fall when the player is 4 blocks away at most. (Horizontally)

value.title: Snake Block Horizontal Distance
value.comment: If 'Falls Onto Snake Block' is checked, the icicle will only fall if the snake block is 'value+8' blocks away at most. (Horizontally)

checkbox.title: Falls Onto Snake Block
checkbox.comment: Unused port from NSMBW. When this is checked, it will only fall when a snake block is underneath it.

checkbox.title: Tilt after falling
checkbox.comment: Unused port from NSMBW. The icicle will tilt to the right after falling.

sprite.name: Stationary Icicle
sprite.notes: A stationary icicle. Meant to be placed on the ceiling of icy and snowy levels. Doesn't fall.

list.title: Size
list.comment: The size of the icicle in blocks. Width by Length.

sprite.name: Horizontally-moving Platform
sprite.notes: A platform that moves horizontally.

list.title: Type
list.comment: The type of platform.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: Determines which way the sprite will move from it's placement.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: Distance for the platform to move.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: Speed of the platform.

value.title: Length
value.comment: Length of the platform.

sprite.name: Scaredy Rat
sprite.notes: A white rat creature that first appeared in New Super Mario Bros. Wii. They appear to have black sclera, red pupils, orange feet and huge buck teeth. They slightly resemble Little Mousers. Their name is a pun on the term scaredy cat, which is a childish term for a coward.

checkbox.title: Glowing Eyes*
checkbox.comment:
The eyes of the Scaredy Rat's will glow red in the dark.
*WARNING: Do NOT use this option if darkness isn't enabled, it will make an extra pair of eyes spawn at the sprite's position.

value.title: Amount
value.comment: Value + 1

sprite.name: Grrrol Spawner
sprite.notes: Spawns the rolling spike-balls named "Grrrols (33)".

list.title: Spawn Frequency
list.comment: The speed which the spawner spits out Grrrols. *Don't use mode 3 it's very buggy.

value.title: Pipe Length
value.comment: Value + 3. The length of the pipe extending from the generator.

list.title: Spawn Direction
list.comment: There is no Up spawner.

list.title: Max Grrrol Count
list.comment: If more grrrols are active at once the spawner does not spawn any grrrols until enough grrrols are despawned.

value.title: Spawn Delay
value.comment: The delay after the first shot. The first shot is always in sync, but the 2nd shot is determined by this value.

value.title: Unknown Value 19*
value.comment: *Set as 1 everywhere except DX 43-51 A1.

sprite.name: Movement-controlled Question Block
sprite.notes: Matches to many movement controllers.

value.title: Unknown Value 6

checkbox.title: Spawn Acorn Mushroom
checkbox.comment: When checked, it will spawn an acorn mushroom.

value.title: Movement ID

value.title: Platform Width

sprite.name: Unfinished wind generator [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: This is supposed to be a wind generator like NSMBW has, but only causes midpoint flags and rope ladders to flutter. It does not produce any other visual or physical effects.

value.title: Time Inactive
value.comment: The game multiplies this value by 60

sprite.name: Snow Effect [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Spawns a snow effect. Replaced by the snow effects in the Frosted Glacier backgrounds.

Green if thin and blue if thick

sprite.name: Event Controller - Brick Block "?" Switch (Orange) [UNUSED]

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: The switch will trigger this event ID when pressed. If the event if already active when this switch spawns, it'll be pressed from the get-go.

checkbox.comment: Used by the game internally. Do not use this!

checkbox.title: Deactivates Target
checkbox.comment: When checked, the switch will deactivate it's target. If the switch is timed, the event will reactivate after the timer is up.

checkbox.title: Multiple uses
checkbox.comment: If this is ticked, the switch will pop up after a while, and you can press it again.

checkbox.comment: Ticking this will place the switch a half a tile to the right. This is a largely pointless leftover from New Super Mario Bros. DS.

checkbox.title: Upside-down*
checkbox.comment: If this is ticked, the switch will be upside-down. Used by the game internally.

checkbox.title: Z-order

sprite.name: Boo
sprite.notes: Boos are a type of white spherical ghost with menacing and constantly open mouths. They are known for their large tongues and small "arms" of some sort. However, the most distinctive characteristic of the Boos is their shy personality, where they cover their faces when someone looks them directly at the face. They will uncover their faces once the subject turns around.

checkbox.title: Starts facing right
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the boo will face to the right at first.

checkbox.title: Starts hiding
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the boo won't move at first, and it will have its 'hiding' animation.

sprite.name: Big Boo
sprite.notes: Also called Atomic Boos or Mega Boos, are a sub-species of Boo. Usually, they resemble and behave similarly to normal Boos, except that they are larger.

sprite.name: Boo Circle Boo [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Normally spawned by a Boo Circle, these can also be placed as sprites. Will remain motionless, but can still hurt the player.

sprite.name: Tile God
sprite.notes: This sprite can spawn in tiles, or destroy tiles.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the tiles affected by the sprite's area will be created/destroyed (depending on the Mode).

checkbox.title: Permanent
checkbox.comment: If this option is checked, the effect of the sprite (creation / destruction) will remain even after the event is deactivated. If this is not checked, previously destroyed tiles will 'respawn' (with their 'Block Type' set) after the initial event is deactivated again.

list.title: Fill Pattern
list.comment: Determines the pattern the area will be filled with.

list.title: Object Type
list.comment:
Here you can select which object type will be used to fill the selected area.

Note: If an event is activated that triggers the 'Tile God' effect to destroy objects, and the event is deactivated afterward, then the area will be filled with the object type selected here (the 'Permanent' checkbox overrides this).

Tip: The number in parentheses () corresponds to the position of the tile in the tileset (tile

list.title: Effect
list.comment: Determines the effect that is triggered when the event is activated. 'Destroy Tiles' can destroy all kinds of objects. It cannot destroy sprites. 'Spawns Tiles' will even create new tiles above other tiles or objects.

value.title: Width
value.comment: Determines the width of the area that is affected.

value.title: Height
value.comment: Determines the height of the area that is affected.

sprite.name: Movement Controller - Bolt

list.title: Style

checkbox.title: Stone Block Sound
checkbox.comment: If activated it will also play the stone block moving sound when spun.

value.title: Return Delay
value.comment: Delays the returning movement of the sprites linked to this bolt.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: The distance linked objects go.

value.title: Bolt ID
value.comment: The ID of the bolt.

sprite.name: Koopaling Magic [UNUSED]

sprite.name: Boom Boom (W4)
sprite.notes: The Frosted Glacier version of Boom boom.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this to hook the sprite to a movement controller.

sprite.name: Wiggler
sprite.notes: A worm that cannot be killed unless collided with sliding Mario. If jumped on, the worm will become angry and faster. He will try harder to reach Mario but still won't fall off cliffs/blocks.

sprite.name: Small Gray Block [UNUSED]
sprite.notes: Spawns a gray block...collision works fine but does nothing otherwise. Won't show up unless it's hooked to a rotation controller

value.title: Width
value.comment: Up to 31

value.title: Movement ID

sprite.name: Floating Bubble

list.comment: Values change, depending on what the movement direction is set to.

list.comment: This setting sets the movement direction of the bubble.

sprite.name: Rope Ladder

list.comment: The number in parenthesis includes top block.

sprite.name: Lighting - Movement-controlled Circle

value.title: Triggering Event ID 1

value.title: Radius
value.comment: Value + 2. In blocks.

list.title: Type
list.comment: 0 means it will always be lit, no matter what. 1 means you can activate it, but even if the event is deactivated, it will stay lit. 2 means it can be turned on when the event ID is activated, and it will turn off when the event is deactivated.

sprite.name: Lighting - Underwater Lamp
sprite.notes: Looks like a porthole with a metal stripe in the middle.

sprite.name: Micro Goomba

sprite.name: 1 x 1 Customizable Ice Block [UNUSED]

sprite.name: Amp
sprite.notes: Will electrify the player once he comes in contact with the Amp.

sprite.name: Movement-controlled Metal Bridge Platform
sprite.notes: A piece of the metal bridge platform. This is the actual bridge piece.

sprite.name: Movement-controlled Metal Bridge Stem
sprite.notes: A piece of the metal bridge. This is the step of the platform, that connects to the base.

sprite.name: Movement-controlled Metal Bridge Base
sprite.notes: A piece of the metal bridge. This is the base with the screw in the center.

sprite.name: Semi-Invisible Platform
sprite.notes: This platform is used in one level in the entire game. It's probably used to help the shell collision in the level it's in, and it's completely invisible if placed in front of tiles.

checkbox.title: Dry Bones On Platform*
checkbox.comment: *A dry bone sprite must be placed somewhere in the level or it will crash when this is activated.

checkbox.title: Z-Order
checkbox.comment: This will place the sprite in front of other sprites. The chains will also be in front of the player.

list.title: Width
list.comment: The size of the platform.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Use this to match it to a swaying controller.

list.title: Delay Before Dropping
list.comment: Unused; Jellybeam will take longer to start going down

value.title: Distance Dropped
value.comment: Unused; Additional distance dropped beyond its base value, repeats after 0-3

sprite.name: Floating Coin
sprite.notes: This is a coin that will float on the surface of water.

value.title: Length
value.comment: The platform length.

sprite.name: Coin - Follows Screen
sprite.notes: Whenever the screen scrolls, this coin scrolls with it, always staying at the same place.

sprite.name: King Bill
sprite.notes: One of the biggest enemies in the game, probably only topped by the Final Bowser.

list.title: Speed (?)
list.comment: {I'm not really sure about this.} King Bill's speed.

value.title: Delay Before Firing Tens (?)
value.comment: Every value is APPROXIMATELY 15 seconds. This could be entirely wrong.

list.title: Direction of movement
list.comment: The direction the King Bill goes to.

value.title: Stretch Block ID
value.comment: Use this to match the controller with sprites 284 or / and 285.

sprite.name: Stretch Block
sprite.notes: A sprite that creates a straight line of orange blocks. The line contracts and expands in a horizontal pattern depicted by a setting. The greater value of nybbles 11 and 12 determines the number of blocks used to create the line.

list.title: Open/Closes
list.comment: The way the block opens and closes. Unused.

value.title: Width 1
value.comment: Width while the blocks are closed.

value.title: Width 2
value.comment: Width while the blocks are open.

value.title: Rotation
value.comment: 24 * value. Sets the rotation of the blocks. Unused.

value.title: Stretch Block ID
value.comment: Use this to match the Stretch Block with sprite 283.

sprite.name: Vertical Stretch Block
sprite.notes: A sprite that creates a vertical line of orange blocks. The line contracts and expands by moving left and right. The greater value of nybbles 11 and 12 determines the number of blocks used to create the line.

checkbox.title: Unknown Value 9
checkbox.comment: Inferred from sprite 284...

value.title: Stretch Block ID
value.comment: Use this to match the Stretch Block with sprite 283.

value.title: Horizontal Distance
value.comment: When set, the lava bubble also travels this number of blocks horizontally. The sprite should be placed at the highest point - the centre of the horizontal movement.

list.title: Size
list.comment: Use this to determine the size of the bush.

sprite.name: Cheep Chomp [UNUSED]

If set to 0, the leaf will start growing after an amount of time it has been on the screen. (This option is pretty much useless, because of the minuscule delay.)

sprite.name: Snake Block - NSLU
sprite.notes: The only difference between this and 222 is that this one needs to be further away from the camera to despawn.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event is triggered when the snake block reaches the end of its path.

list.title: At The End
list.comment: What the snake blocks do once it hits the last path point. Higher values cause crashes. Value 4 can be used to create looping snake blocks. To do this, make sure the path's start and end node are on the same position and set this to 4.
list.entry: Fall (Piece by piece - first to last)
Falls (Piece by piece - last to first)

list.title: Size
list.comment: This sets the size of the thing.

list.title: Initial Direction
list.comment: This is very glitchy when this setting does not match the direction of the first part of the path.

list.title: Start Condition
list.comment: That snake block will start moving after this condition is met.

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: Use this to specify the path the snake block follows. Only values less than 32 can be used.

list.title: Number of blocks
list.comment: This is glitchy when the length is longer than the distance from the first to the second node of the path.

value.title: Repeat-related Path Node
value.comment: When nybble 7 is set to 'Repeat movement', this value is used to get a path node with unknown purpose.

checkbox.title: Icy [UNUSED]
checkbox.comment: Makes the snake blocks appear frozen when checked. They're also slippery.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: The speed of the snake blocks.

value.title: Group ID
value.comment: The ID used to chain sprites together. Use sprite 196 to create the groups.

sprite.name: Tile God - NSLU
sprite.notes: Exactly the same as NSMBU tile god, except the effect is placed a half tile higher.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the tiles affected by the sprite's area will be created/destroyed (depending on the Mode).

checkbox.title: Permanent
checkbox.comment: If this option is checked, the effect of the sprite (creation / destruction) will remain even after the event is deactivated. If this is not checked, previously destroyed tiles will 'respawn' (with their 'Block Type' set) after the initial event is deactivated again.

list.title: Fill Pattern
list.comment: Determines the pattern the area will be filled with.

list.title: Object Type
list.comment:
Here you can select which object type will be used to fill the selected area.

Note: If an event is activated that triggers the 'Tile God' effect to destroy objects, and the event is deactivated afterward, then the area will be filled with the object type selected here (the 'Permanent' checkbox overrides this).

Tip: The number in parentheses () corresponds to the position of the tile in the tileset (tile

list.title: Effect
list.comment: Determines the effect that is triggered when the event is activated. 'Destroy Tiles' can destroy all kinds of objects. It cannot destroy sprites. 'Spawns Tiles' will even create new tiles above other tiles or objects.

value.title: Width
value.comment: Determines the width of the area that is affected.

value.title: Height
value.comment: Determines the height of the area that is affected.

sprite.notes: Lava themed

checkbox.comment: Used to sync gears. Can only be used with large gears and is ignored if a movement-controller isn't used.

checkbox.title: Clockwise

value.title: Rotation Speed
value.comment: Ignored if a movement-controller is used.

value.title: Movement ID

sprite.notes: Has an infinite spawn range.

checkbox.title: Don't Appear In Challenges
checkbox.comment: Some of the original levels are used in challenge mode. This setting makes the signboard not appear in those challenges at all.

list.title: Appearance
list.comment: Use this to give your sign board a fitting theme. Value 2 is supposed to be 'Big', but crashes the game.

checkbox.title: Is path controlled
checkbox.comment: Will forcibly disable "Affected by gravity".

checkbox.title: Place behind other sprites
checkbox.comment: Changes z-order to -2500 if the other z-order nybble is 0

checkbox.title: Affected by gravity
checkbox.comment: Will be forcibly disabled if "Is path controlled" is enabled.

list.title: Inscription
list.comment: Sets the inscription of the signboard.

checkbox.title: Use above collision sensor
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the above collision sensor will be set instead of the adjacent ones. Needs "Affected by gravity" to be enabled.

value.title: Unknown Value 16
value.comment: [1 bit?] No visible change. Only used in as 1 or 0. Levels: NSLU5-21A1 and NSLU5-17A1

value.title: Unknown Value 20
value.comment: [2 bits?] Related to "Affected by gravity". If that bit is not set and this bit is, the level will crash on Cemu.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Bolt ID / Path Controller ID

sprite.name: Event Controller - "P" Switch (Blue) - NSLU
sprite.notes: Seems to be pressable by falling metal boxes, this may require nybbles though.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: The switch will trigger this event ID when pressed. If the event if already active when this switch spawns, it'll be pressed from the get-go.

checkbox.title: Affected by gravity
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the switch will be movable by the environment.

checkbox.title: Non-timed
checkbox.comment: When checked, the event will not be timed when it's switched.

checkbox.title: Shift a tile vertically
checkbox.comment: Shift the switch a tile in the direction it's facing. Used by the game internally.

checkbox.title: Owned by Clampy
checkbox.comment: Used by the game internally. Do not use this!

checkbox.title: Deactivates Target
checkbox.comment: When checked, the switch will deactivate it's target. If the switch is timed, the event will reactivate after the timer is up.

checkbox.title: Multiple uses
checkbox.comment: If this is ticked, the switch will pop up after a while, and you can press it again.

checkbox.title: Shift a half-tile right
checkbox.comment: Ticking this will place the switch a half a tile to the right. This is a largely pointless leftover from New Super Mario Bros. DS.

checkbox.title: Upside-down
checkbox.comment: If this is ticked, the switch will be upside-down.

value.title: Clapping location ID
value.comment: If you collect all tile coins placed in this location, a cheering/clapping effect will be played. It also takes brick blocks and blue coin tiles placed in it into consideration.

checkbox.title: Unknown Checkbox 18
checkbox.comment: Equivalent to nybble (checkbox) 11 of the Location-based Clapping Controller (Sprite 455).

value.title: Unknown Value 19-20
value.comment: Equivalent to nybble (value) 19-20 of the Location-based Clapping Controller (Sprite 455).

list.title: Rise Delay
list.comment: *If nybble 11 (Height) is bigger than 14, the delay is 90 frames (1.5 seconds). Otherwise, you get the delay from this list: { 0 = 125, 1 = 123, 2 = 121, 3 = 124, 4 = 118, 5 = 112, 6 = 109, 7 = 113, 8 = 110, 9 = 107, 10 = 104, 11 = 104, 12 = 101, 13 = 97, 14 = 94 }. 60 frames = 1 second.
